Articles.Content:

Edited July 20, 2020 by FabioofSpace

Can you put that mod list in a spoiler? Quite hard to scroll through on small (mobile/tablet) screens. What version of KSP is this? I’m guessing 1.8.1

What engines are on the upper stage and are they set to 100% throttle? If you launch the rocket manually do the engines work as expected?

14 minutes ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Can you put that mod list in a spoiler? Quite hard to scroll through on small (mobile/tablet) screens. What version of KSP is this? I’m guessing 1.8.1

What engines are on the upper stage and are they set to 100% throttle? If you launch the rocket manually do the engines work as expected?

Its 1.9.1, and it works manually, And I guess the problem might be the KRASH Simulation mod. I'll check if it is

21 minutes ago, FabioofSpace said:

Its 1.9.1, and it works manually, And I guess the problem might be the KRASH Simulation mod. I'll check if it is

Nope, its not

If it works properly in flight then it’s a problem with a mod somewhere. Try removing some mods (the flight information tools etc.) one at a time and maybe that will narrow it down, although it will take a lot of reloading to find out; check the logs for exceptions or errors, unfortunately I can’t access them.

The burn time is very long because the listed thrust is (very close to) zero. Fuel is not the issue as the tools are listing the dV, so it has to be something else.

If the engine burn full thrust during ascent then there’s something causing the wrong readout but that is the direction you need to look at.

The problem is not the long burn time; that’s just a consequence of the root problem, the low thrust readout.

By the way, what exactly is the Near Future: Reduce Thrust Settings Config mod doing? Just curious given the issue you seem to have.

Edited July 20, 2020 by Kerbart

6 hours ago, Kerbart said:

The burn time is very long because the listed thrust is (very close to) zero. Fuel is not the issue as the tools are listing the dV, so it has to be something else.

If the engine burn full thrust during ascent then there’s something causing the wrong readout but that is the direction you need to look at.

The problem is not the long burn time; that’s just a consequence of the root problem, the low thrust readout.

By the way, what exactly is the Near Future: Reduce Thrust Settings Config mod doing? Just curious given the issue you seem to have.

The reduced thrust config is for editing Near Future electric engines. Also, I removed Persistent thrust, and now I will try test if that was the case
Removing Persistent Thrust resolved the problem
